title: Update SiteHeader to use newly provided cache-busted header logo asset

requirements.summary: Add the user-provided header logo source image and a derived 112px-tall transparent PNG (cache-busted) under frontend/public/assets/generated/
acceptanceCriteria: A new logo source image file is present under frontend/public/assets/generated/ (do not serve the image from the backend).
A derived header-optimized transparent PNG at exactly 112px height is present under frontend/public/assets/generated/ with a cache-busting filename.
The generated PNG preserves the logo aspect ratio (no stretching) and has no unnecessary padding unless required to avoid clipping.

file_operations.description: Add the original uploaded header logo source image as a static frontend asset (no backend serving).

Add the derived header-optimized transparent PNG at exactly 112px height (preserve aspect ratio; no distortion; no extra padding unless needed to avoid clipping) using the specified cache-busting filename.

requirements.summary: Update only the SiteHeader home-link logo src to the new cache-busted 112px-tall generated asset
acceptanceCriteria: frontend/src/components/layout/SiteHeader.tsx header logo src is updated to the new /assets/generated/.png path.
No other parts of SiteHeader.tsx are modified besides the header logo element.
The referenced file path exists in the built frontend output, and the header logo no longer appears broken at runtime.

file_operations.description: Modify ONLY the header logo element (the inside the home Link) to replace src "/assets/generated/greenplantz-logo-image-9.dim_auto_x112.cb_20260209_01.png" with "/assets/generated/greenplantz-header-logo-user-upload.dim_auto_x112.cb_20260209_02.png".

requirements.summary: Ensure the SiteHeader logo remains responsive and fits within the h-16 header by adjusting sizing classes only on the same element if needed
acceptanceCriteria: On mobile, tablet, and desktop breakpoints, the header logo remains fully visible within the header (h-16) without vertical overflow or cropping.
The logo image maintains its original aspect ratio (no distortion).
Any CSS/Tailwind class changes are confined to the same header logo element in SiteHeader.tsx.

file_operations.description: If needed to prevent overflow within the h-16 header, adjust ONLY the Tailwind sizing/fit-related classes on the same logo element (keep w-auto and object-contain behavior) to ensure it remains responsive and fully visible across breakpoints without distortion.
